Maasai Mara Wildebeest Migration 2024 Deals

Discover the iconic Masai Mara Situated in the southwest of Kenya, covering an area of 1,510 square km (583 square miles), the Masai Mara National Reserve is a land of breathtaking vistas, abundant wildlife and endless plains. The quintessential Masai Mara safari delivers many attractions, as the reserve is home to an excellent year-round concentration of game, including the more than two million wildebeest, zebras and other antelopes that make up the famous Great Migration. The reserve is a photographer's and naturalist's paradise, with abundant elephant, buffalo, giraffe, lion and cheetah alongside the migratory wildebeest and zebra. Leopards are frequently encountered, endangered black rhino hide in the dense thickets and large rafts of hippo and enormous crocodiles are found in the Mara River. The park is also home to hundreds of bird species.

3 Days Samburu Package

Samburu is among Kenyas most scenic reserves, with riverine forest along the lovely Ewaso Nyiro River. Close to the river is also where youre most likely to see leopards. Near the river, dry acacia scrub and semi-arid savannah, peppered with termite mounds, takes over and extends all the way to the mountains that define the parks northern boundary. Koitogor Hill marks the middle of the reserve.

5 Days Zanzibar Package

Zanzibar is a semi-autonomous archipelago off the coast of Tanzania in East Africa. It consists of several islands, with the main ones being Unguja (commonly referred to as Zanzibar Island) and Pemba. The capital and largest city is Zanzibar City, located on the island of Unguja. Zanzibar has a rich history shaped by its strategic location along trade routes. It was a major center for the spice and slave trades, and its culture reflects a blend of African, Arab, Persian, Indian, and European influences. Stone Town, the historic part of Zanzibar City, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its narrow winding streets, historic architecture, and vibrant markets.

5 Days Watamu Malindi & Kilifi Packages

Watamu is a small town located approximately 105 km north of Mombasa and about 15 km south of Malindi on the Indian Ocean coast of Kenya. It lies on a small headland, between the Blue Lagoon and Watamu Bay. Its main economic activities are tourism and fishing. The shoreline in the area features white sand beaches and offshore coral formations arranged in different bays and beaches; Garoda Beach, Turtle Bay, Blue Lagoon Bay, Watamu Bay, Ocean Breeze, Kanani reef, and Jacaranda Beach. They are protected as part of the Watamu Marine National Park. The Marine Park is considered one of the best snorkeling and diving areas on the coast of East Africa. It is also rated the third-best beach in Africa, for its crystal clear water and silver sand beaches. Adapted from the Swahili language "tame" means sweet and "was" means, the name Watamu means "sweet people". This depicts that while you are here youll meet sweet people in terms of services and Malindi is a popular tourist attraction destination. This wonderful coastal destination is located 120 km northeast of the town of Mombasa with so much exciting things to do. Starting from the historical ruins to the National Parks. Established in the 14th century and was also served as a sanctuary to Vasco da Gama during 1498. The popular Vasco da Gama pillar and church was erected by the Portuguese explorer and is testimony to the fact of the friendship of the local people of Malindi with him. Kilifi is a coastal town with many beaches, and a number of these are often crowded with tourists. The beaches in Kilifi are known for their white sand and clear, turquoise waters. Popular beaches in the area include Kilifi Beach, Bofa Beach, and Watamu Beach.

Prices Starting Ksh44,700 View Package

  • Location : Malindi watamu

5 Days South Africa Packages

Cape Town is a port city on South Africa's southwest coast, on a peninsula beneath the Imposing Table Mountain. Slowly rotating cable cars climb to the mountain's flat top, from which there are sweeping views of the city, the busy harbor and boats heading for Robben Island, the notorious prison that once held Nelson Mandela, which is now a living museum. A coming-together of cultures, cuisines and landscapes, there's nowhere quite like Cape Town, a singularly beautiful city crowned by the magnificent Table Mountain National Park.

5 Days 4 Nights Mauritius Packages

Mauritius is an Indian Ocean Island nation and is known for its beaches, lagoons, and reefs. The mountainous interior includes Black River Gorges, a National Park with rainforests, waterfalls, hiking trails, and wildlife like the flying fox. Capital Port Louis has sites such as the Champs de Mars horse track, Eureka plantation house, and 18th-century Sir Seewoosagur Ramgoolam Botanical Gardens

Naivasha Weekend Getaways

Naivasha is a town in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. It is situated around Lake Naivasha, which is one of the Great Rift Valleys freshwater lakes. Naivasha is a charming town with a mix of natural beauty, wildlife, and agricultural activity, making it a popular destination for both Kenyan and international tourists. Lake Elementaita is situated between Lake Nakuru to the south and Lake Naivasha to the north. It is part of the Great Rift Valley, a geological feature known for its unique landscapes and biodiversity. Lake Elementaita is a tranquil and ecologically significant destination in the Great Rift Valley, known for its Soda Ash Lake, diverse birdlife, and scenic landscapes. It offers a more relaxed and off-the-beaten-path experience compared to some of the more popular tourist destinations in the area.

The park is a haven for both black and white rhinoceros.

3 Days Amboseli National Park

Amboseli National Park is also known as the Land Of Giants because of the majestic elephants that roam freely carrying their tremendous tusks. Located about four hours from the southeast of Nairobi-Kenya this park is also famed for the sensational view of the majestic snow-capped Mouth Kilimanjaro. Join us on this 3-day; 2-night tour through the park enjoying the sight of the Big Five, as well as a plethora of other wildlife. All this set against the backdrop of Africa's highest peak; a Photographer's paradise with striking sunrises and sunsets. Get the chance to enjoy the Maasai Village and experience authentic culture and traditions.

7 Days Mombasa Package

The gateway to the coast of Kenya, Mombasa is one of the best travel destinations in Kenya. When Ibn Battuta visited Mombasa in the 14th century, it was a small commercial center, which later on became one of the most important port cities along the East African Coast. Today Mombasa is the largest port in Kenya. Offering a vivacious mix of cultures, entertainment and architectures, Mombasa is an excellent destination for travellers to explore.

5 Days Mombasa Packages

Mombasa is the second largest city in Kenya after Nairobi. The Port of Mombasa is the gateway and exit point for cargo belonging to a vast hinterland that include Kenya, Uganda, Rwanda, Burundi, Democratic Republic of Congo, Tanzania, South Sudan, Somalia and Ethiopia. Mombasa has one of the most popular beaches, hosting both domestic and international tourists. There is a wide variety of hotel options to cater for various traveler budgets. Apart from the nice beaches, other great touristic attractions include: - 1. Fort Jesus which was built in by the Portuguese between 1593 to 1596 overlooking the harbor. 2. Haller Park which is a transformed, previously abandoned limestone quarry into a thriving nature reserve. 3. Mombasa Marine National Park which is one of the busiest of Kenya's offshore reserves, protecting mangroves, seagrass beds, sandy beaches, and coral reef. 4. Old Town which is reminiscent of the days when the Portuguese ruled this important port. The town's inhabitants are mostly of Arab, Asian, and European origin, and the architecture reflects their cultures. 5. Mamba Village Centre in Nyali which is East Africa's largest crocodile farm. Here, you can learn so much about these fascinating amphibians. 6. Mombasa Tusks built of aluminum to commemorate Queen Elizabeth's visit to Mombasa in 1952.

Prices Starting Ksh23,500 View Package

Detail and Includes

  • Hotel
  • Location : Mombasa North Coast

Wildebeest Migration

THE GREATEST SHOW ON EARTH: AFRICA'S WILDEBEEST MIGRATION Get to Witness the World Cup of Wildlife with Bonfire Adventures. Migration Is One of Nature's Greatest Paradoxes; with more than 1.5 million wildebeest migrating in an enormous loop. Recognized as one of the Seven Wonders of The Natural World. this spectacle is said to be spotted from space. Bonfire Adventures will put you in the right place to witness the Mara River Migration. An event guaranteed to take you through a range of emotions; anticipation, heartache, inspiration, and excitement as they face the giant Nile crocodiles.

Elsa Kopje Meru

Elsas Kopje is a stunningly romantic and artistically designed retreat, nestled on Mughwango Hill. This hill was once the very location where George Adamson, nurtured and released orphaned lions. The cottages, ingeniously integrated with the natural rock formations, offer generous living spaces with spacious bedrooms, open lounges, verandas, and luxurious bathrooms, all providing breathtaking panoramic views. Elsas Kopje affords its guests unmatched privacy within the vast, untamed African landscape. The park surrounding it is home to a flourishing rhino sanctuary and is renowned for its abundant wildlife, including large elephant herds, hippos, lions, and diverse birdlife. Meru National Park stands out in East Africa for its rich biodiversity. This rugged and remote park was saved from obscurity, thanks to Elsas Kopje, an acclaimed boutique lodge with a strong commitment to environmental conservation.

Jambo Mutara Camp

Here, you'll find the perfect blend of untamed Africa and unparalleled luxury, surrounded by iconic wildlife. Jambo Mutara Camp-Laikipia is the sole lodging option within the expansive 20,000-acre Mutara Conservancy, boasting only 15 tents. When we say "exclusive," we truly mean it. The camp shares its border with the renowned Ol Pejeta Conservancy, and through our partnership with them, our guests enjoy unrestricted access to this vast 90,000-acre wilderness area. Together, Mutara Conservancy and Ol Pejeta form the largest black rhino sanctuary in East Africa.

The cottages, ingeniously integrated with the natural rock formations, offer generous living spaces with spacious bedrooms, open lounges, verandas, and luxurious bathrooms, all providing breathtaking panoramic views. Elsa's Kopje affords its guests unmatched privacy within the vast, untamed African landscape. The park surrounding it is home to a flourishing rhino sanctuary and is renowned for its abundant wildlife, including large Elephant herds, Hippos, Lions, and diverse birdlife. Meru National Park stands out in East Africa for its rich biodiversity. This rugged and remote park was saved from obscurity, thanks to Elsa's Kopje, an acclaimed boutique lodge with a strong commitment to environmental conservation.

Elsa Kopje Meru

Elsa's Kopje is a stunningly romantic and artistically designed retreat, nestled on Mughwango Hill. This hill was once the very location where George Adamson, nurtured and released orphaned lions. The cottages, ingeniously integrated with the natural rock formations, offer generous living spaces with spacious bedrooms, open lounges, verandas, and luxurious bathrooms, all providing breathtaking panoramic views. Elsa's Kopje affords its guests unmatched privacy within the vast, untamed African landscape. The park surrounding it is home to a flourishing rhino sanctuary and is renowned for its abundant wildlife, including large elephant herds, hippos, lions, and diverse birdlife. Meru National Park stands out in East Africa for its rich biodiversity. This rugged and remote park was saved from obscurity, thanks to Elsa's Kopje, an acclaimed boutique lodge with a strong commitment to environmental conservation.

3 Days Maasai Mara 2024 Deals

Maasai Mara (Masai Mara) is known as Africas greatest wildlife reserve, situated in the southwest Kenya. Famous for the abundance lions, the Great wildebeest migration, where over 1 million wildebeest and zebras follow annual migration route from and to Serengeti to Maasai Mara and the Maasai people well known for their distinctive custom and dress, it is without a doubt one of the most famous safari destinations. The Maasai Mara Ecosystem holds one of the highest lion densities in the world and this is where over two million wildebeest, zebra and Thompsons Gazelle migrate annually. Its hosts over 95 species of mammals and 570 recorded species of bird. This is considered the 7th wonder of the world.
